title: Will online classes end offline teaching? - Quora

response.answer_text: Online Classes are not meant as a closure to some kind of a prevalent teaching methodology that already exists. Online teaching is only simplifying and combining the benefits of a getting best education minus the time specifications, place probabilities or any sort of trouble one faces to get together with the tutor of one’s choice. Online tutoring is a mechanism which brings a capable tutor, a teaching mechanism through a virtual interaction, subject knowledge and delivery all at your customized comfort. You don’t need to bother about how many pupils in a class, it has both group as well as one on one dedicated tutoring options available. You don’t either need to bother about how to reach the venue at a designated time, it can happen anywhere anytime on a system with internet availability. It expands your choice of choosing from a vast number of options available not limiting to what s available in only your vicinity. Alike there are number of benefits of online classes that you get to discover once you undertake a class.

No, online classes do not mean an end to offline teaching. Each training methodology has its pros and cons. Classroom training continues to remain a popular training methodology. With online learning methods, such as virtual instructor-led classrooms and eLearning, it is possible to extend the reach of your training to a wider audience, instead of a restricted number of people. The problem with offline teaching as well as virtual instructor-led training is that they cannot be scheduled on-demand. However eLearning can be accessed on-demand. That’s the reason you have many universities as well as organizations combining both offline and online learning experiences – this way they can make best use of two different training methodologies.
